name: Villa Soro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Charming and exquisite.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Webb: www.villasoro.es
reviews.title: A lovely old villa turned into a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wifi: Yes, free of charge
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in San Sebastian

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Style: Luxury boutique 19th-century mansion, Historical Heritage Building
reviews.title: The best in a nine week trip over France and Spain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Situation: Residential area surrounded by other stately homes close to centre of San Sebastian, within a ten minute walk of the Zurriola beach, the Kursaal Concert and Convention Centre and the old part of town.
reviews.title: What a lovely place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: We loved staying here. The service is top-notch, friendly & helpful. The rooms are comfortable, with nice bathrooms & comfortable beds. It's about a 30 minute walk to the old town, and 15 minutes to the beach, but they have bikes you can use (San Sebastian is VERY bike friendly with bike paths throughout the city). Make sure you reserve one of the bikes, as they get booked quickly. The hotel itself is in a beautiful old mansion, with elegant sitting rooms & lounges throughout.
reviews.title: Great upscale boutique hotel

likes.liked: — Neat building, elegant rooms, superb service, bikes
likes.disliked: — they need more bikes as they book up

reviews.title: Attentive and charming
reviews.text: Villa Soro needs no bells or whistles.... it is quietly confident in all that it offers. Superbly maintained, both inside and out. All of the staff are are attentive to guest needs. The location is only a short walk from the beach and a little longer to the old town. Attention to detail, comfort and pure hospitality are the cornerstones of this establishment. Would return without hesitation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: We really enjoyed staying here. We even liked the fact that it's not in the noisy, crowded center of the city, and it was only a 15-20 minute walk to the center. If you're used to walking cities, this is still a great location. And, best pintxo places are right nearby. It definitely was expensive but we were there during a holiday week so all the nice hotels were pricey. Also, it seems as if San Sebastian has limited options for nice, small hotels.
reviews.title: Terrific Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was very pretty, quiet, and nicely furnished. Staff was nice and helpful, though knowledge about outskirts was somewhat limited. (ie they didn't recommended going to a cider house in august, but we had a really great time and would highly recommend it! and, they didn't give us driving directions there, and the place was very hard to find, had to stop twice for directions)
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall, a really nice hotel, and one of our favorites from trip to northern spain.
reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel

likes.disliked: — Our rooms were in the low groundfloor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for three nights . Aug 2-5 2008.
reviews.title: Nice spot

likes.disliked: — Nothing....maybe the absence of an outdoor pool!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 20 min walk from old town.
reviews.title: Nice but expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its sited on a busy road. We had a room in the annex which was quiet...otherwise might be noisy.
reviews.title: Great little hotel

likes.disliked: — Location was about 15 minutes away from downtown (walking)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were excellent in arranging restaurants, The room was very good --the free soft drinks from the mini bar was a nice touch.
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I ever stayed in
lovely but overpriced
reviews.text: There are six bikes available for guests . Book early to avoid disappointment!!(we had no difficulty )

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night after a special lunch at arzak. Service was fantastic and rooms very spacious. Breakfast was included and was very good with a choice between continental and al carte menu. The hotel is very quiet and perfect for quiet romantic stay
reviews.title: Lovley stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I couldn't recommend the Villa Soro enough !!! We spend 4 amazing days here during our stay in San Sebastian and it made our stay that little bit more special.
reviews.title: A Little Oasis in San Sebastian !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It may be a 4 Star Hotel , but the service was 5 Stars! The Staff couldnt be more helpful and went over and above the call of duty to make our stay enjoyable.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First the location. It was perfect , 5 minutes walk from the Gros beach , and 10-15 minutes from the old town. Although there is a bus stop outside the hotel , and from what we could gather , pretty much every bus we took brought us into the Centre of the old town. However saying that we normally got the number 13 as it brings brings you right to the main street by the old town, and the last bus leaves from the same stop at at 11:30 so its an extremely handy bus to use.
reviews.title: Quaint

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: San Sebastian is a flat town so what better way to see it than by bicycle. Villa Soro provide free bikes which we took full advantage of and took one every morning to get around the city or just to drive to the beach. San Sebastian is convered with bicyle lanes , so it's easy to get around. The Bikes come with a basket at the front and they hotel provides a beach bag with fluffy towel and bottle of water when you want to go to the beach , so just pop it into your basket and away you go !
reviews.title: Super-Duper

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for a gastronomic weekend. The fare included breakfast, a tapas and wine tasting in a bar and a bottle of cava (well,they provided us with a bottle of local wine although our reservation said differently)
reviews.title: Great stay, I recomend it if you're looking for something special

likes.disliked: — walking 15 minutes to the city center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you like boutique hotels were the guest is not just a number, you should go to Villa Soro. The service is really good and the rooms are quite spacious and clean. We received an upgrade for our room.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL BED AND BREAKFAST

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is 15 minutes walking to the city center and the hotel recomend you a few places where you can go for tapas. Our selection is El Lagar and Mil vinos but please stay away from La Cepa: low quality food and overprized.
reviews.title: This is a really great boutique hotel!

likes.liked: — The quality and look of the property, and the serenity and calm of the environment
likes.disliked: — Didn't have a dinner restaurant, but there is plenty of great food nearby

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are frequent travellers and if we go back to San Sebastian we will rather stay in the Villa Soro Hotel than the Maria Cristina.
reviews.title: Excellent Soro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is indeed a place where they have perfected the meaning of the word "service". We arrived on the night of the 24th, when all restaurants had been closed. But as the hotel had informed us of this beforehand and tried to find something suitable for us before, we were prepared, having purchased some food at the incredible Iper Corp at Corta Ingles in Santander. We emailed the hotel to tell them not to worry, that we would be OK with the wine, cheese, chorizo etc that we were bringing with us to munch on that night in our room. When we arrived, we saw that they had set a table for us in our big lovely room so that we could have our Christmas Eve dinner in style! It was just a lovely thing to do which endeared us not only to the hotel but to the beautiful city of San Sebastian. Breakfast in the morning is also first rate. We highly recommend this beautifully restored old building and its amazing staff.
reviews.title: a little gem

likes.disliked: — no restaurant, but michelin star quality close by,and good room service if needed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our two nights at Villa Soro. The 15 minute walk to town is easy and we especially liked being able to walk to and from our fantastic dinner at Arzak. The front desk staff was extremely helpful. The day we arrived they informed us that there was a general strike in San Sebastian and that we shouldn't walk around town. They promptly made reservations for us to visit the Guggenheim Museum, which worked out beautifully. They made a lot of suggestions of special things to see in San Sebastian. We couldn't have been happier with the quality of the room and the breakfast. A very comfortable place to stay!
reviews.title: A lovely experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located a 15min walk to the City centre, with complimentary cycles available, meant that this boutique hotel was a super place to explore San Sebastian.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012
reviews.text: The main house is very elegant with a large, comfortable well furnished drawing room, a bar area and a relaxing lounge.
reviews.title: A beautiful boutique villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was in the main house and a good size, very comfortable with modern facilities and a very spacious bathroom - no room for complaint whatsoever.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was very good with a selection of cereals, cold cuts, fresh fruit and a small selection of hot food choices - a great way to start the day - with lovely serving ladies.
reviews.title: Check you room...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: San Sebastian was the last stop on our 16 day honeymoon, and it couldn't have been more perfect. The bed and breakfast is darling, very centrally located, and very well maintained. Since it is a private home turned into a bed and breakfast, it has the feeling of staying with friends and family on a tree-lined residential street - it's not necessarily located in the most vibrant, lively part of the town. However, San Sebastian in general was not a touristy city with throbbing nightlife, so I think this hotel was perfect. The sitting rooms are comfortable and filled with vintage, elegant furniture and light fixtures. Perfect for their evening happy hour of sherry and charcuterie. The rooms were spacious, filled with light, and the marble bathroom was luxurious (for both bath-havers and shower-takers.) The breakfast is served either outside, or in their beautiful tea room. Like most other bed and breakfasts and hotels in Spain, the breakfast is a combination of local favorites (jamon iberico, manchego, etc.) and continental pastries, breads, and coffee. The staff was very friendly and helpful, providing us with a map of all the sights within walking distance. We loved heading out in the morning and walking along the beach to Old Town. We had a reservation at ARZAK one night, and our hotel was very efficient in getting us a taxi to take us to the restaurant. Overall, the hotel is a gem and a much more intimate way to experience San Sebastian than the larger, fancier hotels. You definitely feel at home at Villa Soro.
reviews.title: Honeymoon heaven!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay was booked through Bella Terra Travel (http://www.bellaterratravel.com/), who had a professional relationship with the hotel. We're so glad we took their advice!
reviews.title: Basement????

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Four of their rooms are in the basement (elevator floor -1). Very little natural light. I never saw an upstairs room, and I'm sure their great. The basement rooms are depressing. One has only one window about two feet by one feet wide.
reviews.title: Excellent staff and attention to detail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I paid 300E, same as the surface people. And felt ripped off.
reviews.title: Pristine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A private house recently turned into a hotel, you can feel at home as you walk in with rooms elegantly furnished with attention to detail but not going over the top. We arrived very late due to flight delay but had a beautifully presented supper in our room despite kitchen being closed. All staff were very attentive and eager to help which cant be taken for granted even in top hotels. I was impressed with cleanliness of linen (pressed immaculately) at breakfast time. I have always noticed imperfections on cleanliness of linen even in top french hotels but not here. Simple elegance of old world without unnecessary song and dance for it!
reviews.title: A gem in Donostia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely intimate hotel which is approximately a 10 minute walk from the town centre and a 10 minute walk from the amazing Arzak’s restaurant (a real treat!). It is extremely quiet so if you’re looking for a lively bar and buzz about the place then this probably isn’t the hotel for you! It’s hard to find fault with Villa Soro, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms are modern as are the bathrooms, the soft drinks in the mini bar are complimentary and at turn down, they leave a selection of buns in your room which was a lovely touch. We did find it expensive however and our room rate did not include breakfast, this aside, I couldn’t but recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: The Best Hotel In San Sebastian - I Have No Doubt

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband I spent 3 nights here in November 2008. It was a bit of a splurge for our off-season tour of the Basque country. Our room was gorgeous and extremely comfortable. We were in an annex behind the main hotel building. In warmer weather, the small outdoor patio would have been lovely. Free internet access (wifi). Free parking. Our rate included breakfast, which was excellent and very generous. Location: 20 minute walk to San Sebastian's center, but plenty of restaurants and bars were nearby (say a 5-10 minute walk). The nearest beach would have been a 10-15 minute walk. We were happy not to have to navigate the city center when arriving at the hotel by car. The staff was friendly and attentive. We'd love to go back.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were only here for 1 night but we were all impressed with this beautiful restored villa. It even has the convenience of an elevator and the Continental Breakfast was lovely. We enjoyed sitting around the wood burning fireplace on a cool evening. The superior rooms were very spacious, one with a balcony and one with a larger sized terrace. Don't miss the chance to walk to Alona Berri for fabulous tapas. It is only a few blacks from the hotel.
reviews.title: Beautiful Villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have just returned from 3 nights at Villa Sorro.
reviews.title: Definately worth a visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: It was beautiful and the staff were fantastic, very helpful & welcoming.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!

likes.liked: — The room, the hotel in general!
likes.disliked: — The manager woman who was rude and unhelpful

aka: Villa Soro Hotel San Sebastian - Donostia
description: Villa Soro occupies 2 classical buildings, one of which was built in 1898 and is a Historical Heritage Building of San Sebastian. Free Wi-Fi is available.All rooms offer free non-alcoholic drinks in the minibar and a DVD player. They each have a separate shower and bath. Rooms have luxury individual design, some including artwork from Jorge Oteiza. Room service is available, offering local dishes.There is free private parking on site. Villa Soro is surrounded by trees and stately homes.The hotel has a gym and offers free bicycles and beach towels. There are spacious lounges and a fireplace.Zurriola Beach, the Kursaal Concert and Convention Centre and the old town are within a short walk.
